alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 5:47PM EDT until July 30 at 12:08PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson affecting Breathitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, Major flooding. Some businesses are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 PM EDT Friday the stage was 40.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 PM EDT Friday was 43.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 4.3 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...The crest surpassed the previous flood of record of 43.10 feet from February 1939 with a crest of 43.47 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued 11 PM.
